results.title: The Panda's boutique
results.creator_credit: Louis Elman, Shen Zuwei, Zhou Keqin, British Broadcasting Corporation and Shanghai Meishu
results.brief_description: A delightful Chinese animation about a family of pandas who run a boutique. Complete chaos is caused, one morning, when customers in all different shapes and sizes arrive and request some oddly shaped items.

results.title: A Catalyst for development, K.T.T.C.
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Kenya is vitally concerned with education. With the help of the Canadian International Development Agency, the government built the Kenya Technical Teachers’ College (K.T.T.C.), where it trains people to teach at every level of technical education. Once trained, these teachers go out to the numerous village polytechnics situated throughout Kenya and teach their skills. By teaching trade skills to villagers, local industries may be developed and technology will be introduced to the country.

results.title: British Columbia: mountains to the sea
results.brief_description: A picturesque film that explores the different wild environments of British Columbia. The film records the change of the seasons and the effects that the changes have on the many species of wildlife and their habitats.

results.title: Bookmaker's progress
results.creator_credit: Donald Winkler, Barrie Howells, Marrin Canell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film on the Quebec publishing scene in general, and on Robert Davies’ Les Editions l’Etincelle in particular. Davies, an Anglophone publishing French books, is attempting to expand into the international marketplace without sacrificing his own integrity. He discusses the difficulties of survival in the limited Quebec book market, and is shown at work in Montreal, Paris and at the Frankfurt Book Fair.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Winkler, Barrie Howells, Marrin Canell and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Book bargain
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and GPO Film Unit
results.brief_description: Set inside a printing factory in the mid 1930’s, this film documents the production of the London telephone directory. Commencing with the preparation of blank rolls of paper, the film progresses through each stage of the production until the directory is ready for delivery. Captures the working conditions and technology of a printing factory in Great Britain in the mid 30’s. Made by Norman McLaren while he was working for Britain’s General Post Office in the 1930s, this film is a novel attempt to inject some interest into what may be considered a dull subject.

results.title: Blake
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this age, when most people follow their dreams passively on the television screen, there are still a few individuals whose passion is for the real thing. Here is a film about such a one, with a passion for wings and the freedom of the skies. Filmed by Bill Mason, whose own devotion is to the canoe, the subject here is his friend Blake James, another filmmaker, who pilots his own one-man plane. The film is Mason’s view of this “hobo of the skies” but it is also an adventure. Photography: Bill Mason, Blake James. (Five awards, including Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Mason, Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Better way
results.brief_description: In order to keep Canada’s vast quantities of mail moving, Canada Post dug around for a suitable solution. They came up with MAPP (Major Area Postal Plant), an ingenious, highly complex, streamlined system that relies on the postal code for efficient operation. The postal code relies on you and me, the mailing public, for inclusion in the address. The film tells what happens when a piece of mail is set on its course. No other credits available.

results.title: Easy street [Music version]
results.brief_description: The Tramp, played by Chaplin, reformed by angelic Edna Purviance, joins the police force and his first job is to tame the local bully (Eric Campbell). Also features Albert Austin and Henry Bergman. Musical score by Winston S. Sharples. No spoken word or intertitles - music soundtrack only.
